titles.title: Right to Know Act of 2000
To prohibit the use of Federal funds for the conduct or support of programs of HIV testing that fail to make every reasonable effort to inform the individuals of the results of the testing.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 11/1/2000--Introduced. Right to Know Act of 2000 - Prohibits funds in any Federal appropriations Act for any fiscal year from being used to conduct or support any program of testing individuals for infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) in which there is a failure to find and disclose to the tested individuals the test results, together with appropriate counseling.
